column4: hey guys how can i install updates from the terminal? I have downloaded them by saying sudo apt-get updates...but i don't know how to install them manually.
sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get upgrade && sudo apt-get dist-upgrade
what does get upgrade and get-dist-upgrade do?
upgrade makes sure the system is up to date.. dist-upgrade looks for packages that can move from and installed version to a newer version
i also said sudo apt-get upgrade
but dist-upgrade will NOT take you from say 8.04 to 8.10 .. sudo apt-get upgrade looks for packages needing upgrading.
stuck at bios? or a terminal prompt?
yes.. doesn't make any sense.
how new is your motherboard/computer.. and do you know the chipset?  like intel?
when you say bios splash screen.. what are you seeing?  typically you're either "in" the bios or not
It's the splash screen, so what I'm trying to say is that i am not inside of the BIOS
splash screen for ubuntu?
no. The BIOS screen.
Were it gives you the option to Enter Setup...
the BIOS lol
It is very weird.
that's why I asked what you were actually looking at.. that's like the post screen.. do you have acpi off in the bios?
Would that make a difference? I can't say if i do or not i would need to restart.
I am going to disable the ACPI option.
might.. but what's really weird is once the system goes down for a reboot from the post ubuntu has nothing to do with the machine.. no control at all.
I know :) it is weird.
Let me try to disable the ACPI
